stripped_doc: Function to select which position set to restore windows to
Variable.doc:
Function to select which position set to restore windows to

Notes:
 * The function should take no arguments and return a string matching a location in RestoreWindows.appLayouts
Variable.name: locationFunction
notes: * The function should take no arguments and return a string matching a location in RestoreWindows.appLayouts
Variable.desc: Function to select which position set to restore windows to

stripped_doc: A table mapping applications, locations and screen layouts
Variable.name: appLayouts
notes: * A table mapping locations to applications to either a table to be used by hs.layout.apply (with app name prepended) or a string to be run as Applescript
-- {window title, screen name, unit rect, frame rect, full-frame rect}
Variable.desc: A table mapping applications, locations and screen layouts

parameters: * mapping - A table containing hotkey modifier/key details for the following items:
* restoreOrChooser - Single tap for restoreWindows, double tap for an action chooser
* restoreWindows - Restore windows to positions for spoon.RestoreWindows:location()
* restoreFrontmost - Restore just the windows of the frontmost application
* reportFrontmost - Report the position of the frontmost window (which you might add to your appLayouts)
stripped_doc: Binds hotkey for RestoreWindows
items.doc:
Binds hotkey for RestoreWindows

Parameters:
 * mapping - A table containing hotkey modifier/key details for the following items:
  * restoreOrChooser - Single tap for restoreWindows, double tap for an action chooser
  * restoreWindows - Restore windows to positions for spoon.RestoreWindows:location()
  * restoreFrontmost - Restore just the windows of the frontmost application
  * reportFrontmost - Report the position of the frontmost window (which you might add to your appLayouts)

Returns:
 * The RestoreWindows object
items.name: bindHotkeys
